content: It seems to me that a company today is like a conveyor belt. The person hiring you isn’t always your manager or the owner. It’s someone in HR whose job it is to keep the conveyor belt full of workers. If someone leaves the conveyor belt (fired, retired, or hired by someone else) then they really just want someone who is ‘good enough’ to replace you. They don’t actually care if you’re going to do your very best, amazing work, just as long as you don’t annoy anyone, stuff up really bad or break the law. If you’re super talented and do amazing work they will hire you. If that person isn’t available, they’ll hire the next best person that they can get. If you’re competing with someone else who is highly talented for a job, then that is good for the company hiring you, but only they ultimately benefit from the competition to be better than other applicants. They’ll always just take the best that they can get, and that’s good enough.
